sourceDesc.p: Born digital, but generated using XSLT.

person.education: Masters of Arts in English (Science and Technology Research Stream) at University of British Columbia, Vancouver, British Columbia.
Bachelor of Arts (Honours with distinction) in English and Women's Studies (minor) at University of Victoria, Victoria, British Columbia.

list.head: Awards
list.item: Social Science and Humanities Research Grant (Masters) (2016)
University of Victoria Department of English Medal of Excellence (2016)

listBibl.head: Publications
listBibl.bibl: Holmes, Martin, and Joseph Takeda (50%). "Beyond Validation: Using Programmed Diagnostics to Learn About, Monitor, and Successfully Complete Your DH Project." Digital Scholarship in the Humanities (DSH). Forthcoming.

Jenstad, Janelle, and Joseph Takeda (50%). "Making the RA Matter: Pedagogy, Interface, and Practices." Making Things and Drawing Boundaries: Experiments in the Digital Humanities. Ed. Jentery Sayers. Minnesota: University of Minnesota Press, 2018. 71–85.
Takeda, Joseph. "The MoEML Finding Aid to the Bills of Mortality." The Map of Early Modern London. Ed. Janelle Jenstad. University of Victoria. Forthcoming.

Project documentation and numerous encyclopedia articles on London places authored, co-authored, and edited for The Map of Early Modern London, including: "Barbican," and "Wood Street." For a full list of my contributions to MoEML, see http://mapoflondon.uvic.ca/TAKE1.htm.

listBibl.head: Conference Presentations
listBibl.bibl: Takeda, Joseph. "'Depth and width between the surface': Reading Vertical Mobility in François Mandeville's 'How Copper Was Discovered' and Marie Clements’ Burning Vision." Endnotes 2018 conference. University of British Columbia. May 05, 2018.
Takeda, Joseph. "Rethinking Protocols: Networking, Temporality, Decolonization." Qualicum History conference. Parksville, British Columbia. January 27, 2018.

Holmes, Martin, and Joseph Takeda (50%). "Beyond Validation: Using Programmed Diagnostics to Learn About, Monitor, and Successfully Complete Your DH Project." Digital Humanities 2017 conference. McGill University. August 11, 2017. PDF. Repository.
Jenstad, Janelle, Tye Landels-Gruenewald, and Joseph Takeda (33%). "Mapping the STC with MoEML and DEEP." Digital Humanities 2017 conference. McGill University. August 9, 2017. PDF.
Takeda, Joseph. "The Fragility of Reconciliation: Reading The Book of Jessica." CSPT Graduate conference. University of Victoria. May 05, 2017.
Takeda, Joseph. "Viewing Jewish and Trans Identity: History, Genetics, and Jill Soloway's Transparent." Qualicum History conference. Parksville, British Columbia. January 28, 2017.

Jenstad, Janelle, Tye Landels-Gruenewald, and Joseph Takeda (33%). "How To Do Things with 6000 Toponyms." How To Do Things with Millions Of Words conference. University of British Columbia. November 03, 2016.

occupation.p: Teaching Assistant for ENGL110: Introduction to Media Studies.
Teaching Assistant for ENGL110: Indigenous and Multicultural Literature in Canada.
Guest Lecturer for ENGL 362, "Popular Literature in the Renaissance".
Guest Lecturer for SLST 481, "Existence and Anxiety in Dostoevsky".
Programmer at Linked Early Modern Drama Online.
Programmer at The Map of Early Modern London.
Research Assistant at Winnifred Eaton Archive.
Programmer at Stratford Festival Promptbook Protocol The Stratford Festival Online.
Programmer at The Internet Shakespeare Editions.
Junior Programmer/Research Assistant at Endings .
Junior Programmer/Consultant at The Map of Early Modern London .
Assistant to the Coordinating Editor at Scene Performance Journal, The Internet Shakespeare Editions.
Encoder at The Map of Dostoevsky's St. Petersburg .
Research Assistant at The Internet Shakespeare Editions .
Research Assistant at The Map of Early Modern London.
Member, Works in Progress Committee at UBC English Graduate Caucus.
Union Representative at UBC English Graduate Caucus.
Communications Coordinator at UBC English Graduate Caucus.
Co-organizer at Endnotes Graduate Conference.
Editor-in-chief at The Albatross English Undergraduate Journal.
Executive Editor at The Warren Undergraduate Review.
Vice-President of Academic Affairs at English Students' Association.
Criticism Editor at The Warren Undergraduate Review.
